sections.title: Cookies on the NHS website
paragraphs: We've put some small files called cookies on your device to make our site work.

We'd also like to use analytics cookies. These collect feedback and send information about how our site is used to services called Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Qualtrics Feedback and Google Analytics. We use this information to improve our site.
Let us know if this is OK. We'll use a cookie to save your choice. You canread more about our cookiesbefore you choose.
You can change your cookie settings at any time using ourcookies page.

sections.title: Causes of heavy periods
paragraphs: It can be normal to have heavy periods.
They can sometimes be heavy at different times, like when you first start your periods, after pregnancy or approachingmenopause.

Rarely, heavy periods can be a sign ofwomb cancer.

sections.title: Treatment for heavy periods
paragraphs: Heavy periods do not always need to be treated. But there are treatments that can help if they’re affecting your daily life.
If these treatments do not work or a GP thinks a condition may be causing your heavy periods, they’ll usually refer you for tests or to see a specialist.
